snippet: The New York City Housing Authority was woefully unprepared to reach its residents stranded by Hurricane Sandy without heat, power or access to supplies.
abstract: Examination by The New York Times finds that the New York City Housing Authority was woefully unprepared to reach residents stranded by Hurricane Sandy without heat, power or access to supplies; while agency moved aggressively before the storm to encourage residents to leave, both it and the city government at large were woefully unprepared to help its residents deal with Hurricane Sandy’s lingering aftermath.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and MICHAEL MOSS

lead_paragraph: The New York City Housing Authority was woefully unprepared to reach its residents stranded by Hurricane Sandy without heat, power or access to supplies.

headline.seo: City Housing Agency Was Overwhelmed After Storm
headline.main: Housing Agency’s Flaws Revealed by Storm
headline.print_headline: Housing Agency’s Flaws Revealed by Storm
